column1: Raúl Alonso Jiménez Rodríguez (American Spanish: [raˈul xiˈmenes]; born 5 May 1991) is a Mexican professional footballer who plays as a forward for Premier League club Wolverhampton Wanderers and the Mexico national team.
He began his career in Club América's youth system before debuting in the first division in October 2011. He won his first championship with América in 2013
column2: winning the Clausura tournament
column3: and was the team's second-highest goalscorer. In August 2014
column4: Jiménez joined Spanish side Atlético Madrid. After one season
column5: he signed for Benfica
column6: with whom he won two consecutive league titles
column7: among other major honours. He amassed 120 appearances and scored 31 goals during his three years with the Portuguese side. In June 2018
column8: Jiménez joined Wolverhampton Wanderers on loan
column9: and was the team's top-scorer with 17 goals across all competitions. He joined Wolves on a permanent basis the following year.

column1: Jiménez was a part of the Mexican squad that won the gold medal at the Summer Olympics in 2012. A full international since 2013
column2: Jiménez has represented his country at the 2014 and 2018 FIFA World Cup
column3: the 2013 and 2019 CONCACAF Gold Cup
column4: the 2013 and 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
column5: the 2015 Copa América

column1: Jiménez was called up by Juan Carlos Osorio to participate in the Copa América Centenario. He made three appearances but did not score.
